sourceMeaningMnemonic: You come across a <radical>gold</radical> <radical>hill</radical>. You think you hit it big! You start digging, only to find out that it is merely a paper-thin layer of gold covering a hill of <kanji>steel</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Dig out many other spots. Every time, it's just steel under there.
readingMnemonic: You report your findings about the <kanji>steel</kanji> you found to Emperor <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>. He is displeased that it is a hill of steel.
readingInfo: "I suppose I can use this steel, even if it is not a hill of gold," he says. "We will make steel weapons, which we will use to subjugate other nations. The whole world will learn kanji using the WaniKani system!"
